noun.description: The action of remigrating; return; an instance of this.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Andrew Willet (d. 1621), Church of England clergyman and religious controversialist. Originally from post-classical Latin remigration-, remigratio return from classical Latin remigrāt-, past participial stem of remigrāre + -iō. In later use probably partly also from re- + migration, after remigrate.
